articles.title: Los r√≠os voladores del Amazonas en riesgo por deforestaci√≥n y sequ√≠as
articles.description: Los r√≠os voladores que llevan lluvias al continente se debilitan por la deforestaci√≥n, elevando el riesgo de sequ√≠as y un colapso ecol√≥gico en el Amazonas.
articles.content:
El pulso invisible que sostiene al Amazonas

Muy por encima de los √°rboles, invisibles a los ojos, los llamados ‚Äúr√≠os voladores‚Äù transportan la humedad desde el Atl√°ntico hacia el coraz√≥n de Sudam√©rica. Son corrientes a√©reas que sostienen lluvias, cultivos, comunidades ind√≠genas y hasta la generaci√≥n hidroel√©ctrica. Sin embargo, estos r√≠os invisibles se debilitan, amenazados por la deforestaci√≥n y el avance de las sequ√≠as que ya marchitan cultivos en Per√∫, vac√≠an represas en Ecuador e incendian bosques en el propio Brasil.

La deforestaci√≥n rompe el ciclo del agua

El an√°lisis del Proyecto de Monitoreo de la Amazon√≠a Andina (MAAP) muestra que la tala masiva interrumpe este delicado bombeo natural. Cada √°rbol talado es un fragmento menos de humedad liberada al aire. El sur de Per√∫ y el norte de Bolivia figuran entre las regiones m√°s vulnerables, pues dependen de la humedad que cruza el sur de Brasil, justo donde la deforestaci√≥n se intensifica a lo largo de carreteras y granjas. La ecuaci√≥n es simple y devastadora: menos √°rboles, menos lluvia.

Los pueblos ind√≠genas ya sienten el impacto. Sus calendarios ancestrales, que marcan cu√°ndo sembrar, pescar o cazar, se desincronizan ante lluvias irregulares y cada vez m√°s escasas. Las familias agricultoras sufren cosechas fallidas, los pescadores enfrentan temporadas impredecibles y las ciudades viven cortes de electricidad por represas sin agua suficiente. La selva, convertida en una vasta bomba de vapor, empieza a fallar en su misi√≥n vital.

El cient√≠fico brasile√±o Carlos Nobre advirti√≥ que si la deforestaci√≥n alcanza entre 20% y 25% y el calentamiento global supera los 2 grados Celsius, no habr√° vuelta atr√°s: el Amazonas podr√≠a transformarse en una sabana. La estaci√≥n seca ya dura cinco semanas m√°s que hace 45 a√±os, con un 30% menos de lluvia. Este es el punto de inflexi√≥n temido: un cambio irreversible que pondr√≠a en jaque al planeta entero al liberar cantidades masivas de carbono.

El papel crucial de la cooperaci√≥n regional

Aunque Per√∫ ha creado reservas como el Parque Nacional Manu, estas acciones resultan insuficientes si Brasil, epicentro de los frentes de deforestaci√≥n, no refuerza su protecci√≥n. Cient√≠ficos como Corine Vriesendorp insisten en que la soluci√≥n solo puede ser regional, con compromisos conjuntos entre pa√≠ses amaz√≥nicos. La humedad que alimenta los r√≠os voladores no reconoce fronteras pol√≠ticas; depende de un ecosistema interconectado.

Los expertos coinciden en que la respuesta debe ser inmediata: cero deforestaci√≥n, restauraci√≥n de medio mill√≥n de kil√≥metros cuadrados y protecci√≥n de los flujos atmosf√©ricos que hacen posible la selva tropical. Incluso proponen nuevas categor√≠as de conservaci√≥n centradas no solo en el territorio, sino en los r√≠os voladores como recurso estrat√©gico. Protegerlos equivale a salvaguardar la estabilidad clim√°tica de Sudam√©rica y del planeta entero.

El futuro del Amazonas est√° en juego

La cuenca amaz√≥nica ya perdi√≥ 17% de su cobertura forestal. Los incendios, la ganader√≠a y la expansi√≥n agr√≠cola han mermado un sistema que mantiene el equilibrio clim√°tico global. Lo que ocurre en el Amazonas no se queda en Sudam√©rica: sus lluvias invisibles sostienen la biodiversidad, la agricultura y hasta el aire que respiramos. El reloj clim√°tico corre, y la decisi√≥n est√° en manos de los gobiernos y sociedades de la regi√≥n.

articles.title: Setting the Stage for the CUSMA Review - Policy Magazine
articles.description: As Canada, the United States, and Mexico gear up for the review of the Canada-United States-Mexico Agreement (CUSMA) scheduled for July 1st, 2026, now is a
articles.content:
As Canada, the United States, and Mexico gear up for the review of the Canada-United States-Mexico Agreement (CUSMA) scheduled for July 1st, 2026, now is a good time to take stock. How is Canada doing in its efforts to maintain and restore exports lost to the American market over the past several months of tariff disruption, to strengthen our economy, and diversify our trade with other markets?

It has been a difficult, chaotic, confusing year on the trade front. Donald Trump‚Äôs disruptive, protectionist actions and threats have sent shock waves through the Canadian economy and spooked businesses contemplating new investments in Canada. So much has happened that it is hard to keep track of the various onslaughts in Trump‚Äôs assault on the global trade status quo rationalized by an effort to repatriate the manufacturing of goods intended for the US market. The Canadian Federation of Independent Business has produced a good summary of the current situation in what they call the ‚ÄúCanada-U.S. Trade War‚Äù. The Department of Finance has a web page that documents the responses of the Canadian government to the American actions.

Throughout late September, the three North American partners all launched their own domestic consultations designed to gather input on how to approach the review of the CUSMA scheduled by the agreement for next Canada Day. Canada‚Äôs consultation process began on September 20th and runs through November 3rd.

The essential task of the review will be to assess the operation of the agreement and to determine whether it should be extended for a further period of 16 years beyond 2036. Without such agreement, the CUSMA will terminate on July 1, 2036. (Per Article 34.7, Section 1: ‚ÄúThis Agreement shall terminate 16 years after the date of its entry into force, unless each Party confirms it wishes to continue this Agreement for a new 16-year term‚Äù) As part of this review, the agreement envisages under Article 34.7, Section 2 that each country ‚Äúmay provide recommendations for the Commission (of ministers set up to manage the agreement) to take action at least one month before the Commission‚Äôs joint review meeting takes place.‚Äù Such recommendations could include proposals to amend the CUSMA.

Of course, the Trump administration could also decide to simply withdraw from the agreement under Article 34.6, after giving the required six months‚Äô notice. However, such action would still leave the CUSMA in force between Canda and Mexico. Another possibility is that Trump might decide to completely ignore American obligations under the agreement thereby rendering it useless. But for the moment at least, the Trump administration seems to be preparing for the CUSMA review in a way that suggests they are taking it seriously.

Canada is not alone in facing this erratic behaviour from the U.S., so we need to keep an eye on what is happening more broadly as we try to improve Canada‚Äôs prospects.

A few considerations stand out and should play an important role in shaping the Canadian approach to the CUSMA review and managing our trade interests more broadly.
‚Ä¢ Importantly, the actual impact of the headline tariffs imposed by Trump on Canadian exports has turned out to be much less than was anticipated back in March when the 25% fentanyl/border tariff was announced on all Canadian and Mexican exports. These tariffs were increased to 35% on August 1. The key point is that these tariffs only apply to non-CUSMA-compliant goods from Canada. To prove compliance to US Customs, documentation must be provided that shows the product qualifies under the CUSMA rules of origin as being Canadian. Before Trump, many businesses that could qualify didn‚Äôt bother because the most favoured nation (MFN) duty applied by the U.S. to almost all imports was zero or very low. This way, Canadian businesses avoided having to pay the administrative cost of proving compliance. In February, only about 35% of Canadian exports to the U.S. were CUSMA compliant which meant that some 65% of Canadian exports would be subject to the duty. By July, nearly 85% of Canadian exports were compliant. So, it became apparent that for most Canadian exports the U.S. was respecting the CUSMA requirement for duty-free treatment. This meant most Canadian (and Mexican) exports were enjoying much better treatment than those of any other country. Six months ago, it seemed Trump had effectively torn up the CUSMA. Now it seems CUSMA is offering Canadians lower duties than any other country except Mexico. A chart from the National Bank provides insight into what has happened. Throwing out the CUSMA in disgust over American behaviour is not a good strategy for Canada.
‚Ä¢ Unfortunately, some important sectors of Canadian exports are still burdened by high U.S. duties: lumber (35%) automobiles (25%), steel and aluminum (50%) and some copper products (50%). And Trump is proposing new tariffs in other sectors. These American sectoral tariffs apply to imports from all countries.
‚Ä¢ At the end of July, Trump announced a series of so-called reciprocity tariffs on about 90 countries at varying rates, supposedly to reflect how open each market is to U.S. exports. In addition, the administration has been pursuing new trade deals with other countries to provide better access for American exporters. The deals that have been reached accord lower across-the-board duties to many of the United States‚Äôs most important partners, including the UK (10%), the EU (15%), Japan (15%), South Korea (15%), Indonesia and the Philippines (19%), Vietnam (20%). All these tariffs are a clear violation of the WTO‚Äôs Most Favored Nation (MFN) obligation and also American tariff obligations under the WTO. And the so-called deals agreed with the U.S. are really just ‚Äúhandshake‚Äù or ‚Äúframework‚Äù deals that provide no assurance of durability such as being enacted into American law by the Congress. Another systemic problem with these deals is that America‚Äôs partners have granted more favorable access to the Americans than to other non-free trade partners. This means these countries are also in violation of their MFN WTO obligations. So not only has the U.S. gone rogue but the WTO is under duress from actions by other countries as well.
‚Ä¢ Overall, uncertainty prevails for all countries about what tariff rates will apply to their trade particularly in the U.S. market. Without strong remedial action, this uncertainty will lead to general economic decline.
‚Ä¢ Another key factor to keep in mind is that domestic U.S. support for Trump‚Äôs trade and tariff policies is waning. In fact, his policies may well be blamed for any increased inflation and any economic slowdown, both of which seem likely. Canadians shouldn‚Äôt be pressing for an early conclusion to the process of reviewing and possibly renegotiating the CUSMA. While deliberate delay could prove counterproductive, we certainly shouldn‚Äôt be in a hurry to conclude a deal that is not in Canada‚Äôs interest. As we get closer to next year‚Äôs midterm Congressional elections, American support for Trump‚Äôs policies is likely to erode dramatically.

Given this background and the damaging prospect of continued uncertainty, Canada should urgently:
‚Ä¢ Continue efforts to reform and improve our domestic economic performance through regulatory reform and eliminating internal barriers to trade.
‚Ä¢ Take bold steps to strengthen Canada‚Äôs capacity as a natural resource powerhouse using this as a primary way of diversifying and strengthening trade and investment ties with European and Pacific partners. There has never been a more propitious time to achieve these diversification objectives. Our European partners are desperate to reduce their dependency on Russia for the supply of needed industrial materials including oil and gas and critical minerals. Our Asian partners in the CPTPP are worried by the growing strength of China and the unpredictability of the United States. The efforts of the Prime Minister and his ministers to make the case with foreign leaders, businesses and international investors should be intensified in the months ahead. Some are questioning whether strengthened partnerships with these partners will make any difference in a meaningful time frame and whether the government can afford any investment that might be needed to develop new resource projects. Prime Minister Mark Carney‚Äôs meetings with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz in Berlin last month and the agreement on critical minerals they announced on August 26 show that securing German participation and investment for such projects is well be within reach. In fact, Canada‚Äôs clear objective should be to get international partners to finance such investment while respecting Canadian laws and regulations.
‚Ä¢ Work with our European and TransPacific partners to salvage the multilateral trading system centered in the WTO. This system should be strengthened and reformed. It will be needed to underpin Canada‚Äôs efforts at diversification.
‚Ä¢ Attach top priority to preparing for the review of CUSMA and its potential renegotiation. The United States is and will remain for the foreseeable future Canada‚Äôs dominant trade and economic partner. The government should:
‚Ä¢ develop a full analysis of the operation of the CUSMA that will enable Canada to participate in the review in a constructive and forward-looking manner,
‚Ä¢ develop Canadian proposals for how the operation of the agreement could be improved,
‚Ä¢ consider how to respond to likely American proposals for changes to the CUSMA. Such responses should allow Canada to listen constructively but resist anything which is not in Canada‚Äôs interest,
‚Ä¢ work closely with the provinces, the private sector and all interested Canadians and groups of Canadians in developing Canada‚Äôs approach,
‚Ä¢ work closely with congressional members, state governments, and groups and individuals to explain Canada‚Äôs thinking and explore common approaches,
‚Ä¢ work closely with Mexico, with whom Canada shares the objective of ensuring the continuance of a strong and effective CUSMA, while recognizing that on some matters our interests will inevitably differ.

While the challenges may appear daunting, the government should use the coming year to build the groundwork for Canada‚Äôs future prosperity and security. Looking back 50 years from now, we may well conclude that these changes would not have been possible without the shocks to Canadian complacency from Donald Trump.

John Weekes, who was Canada‚Äôs chief negotiator for the original NAFTA and ambassador to the WTO, is a member of the Expert Group on Canada-U.S. Relations, and a fellow of the Canadian Global Affairs Institute.

articles.title: Ransomware hackers strike pharmacy as tactics 'evolve'
articles.description: Small businesses are being warned to re-evaluate their cybersecurity systems after hackers targeted a regional Queensland pharmacy.
articles.content:
Small businesses are being warned about the rise of ransomware attacks after hackers targeted a regional Queensland pharmacy.

Hackers gained access to the Friendlies Society Dispensary at Toowoomba, west of Brisbane, last month, potentially compromising data kept on the business's private IT storage device.

The Cyber Research Centre at the University of Queensland said ransomware accounted for 11 per cent of cyber attacks reported to the Australian Signals Directorate (ASD).

"Criminals now steal and leak data, and ransomware can now be delivered entirely via the browser, when you install an app, or even when you just upload files to a malicious site."

An investigation involving the National Office of Cyber Security, the Australian Cyber Security Centre, Services Australia, the National Disability Insurance Agency, Queensland Health and the Department of Home Affairs has been launched into the Toowoomba incident.

In a statement, Toowoomba Friendlies Society Dispensary CEO Bayden Johnson told the ABC he did not know exactly what data was accessed.

"As soon as this incident was detected, we immediately worked to secure our systems and to establish a clear picture of what happened," Mr Johnson said.

"We are working as a priority to determine exactly what information this data contains so we can ensure that all appropriate steps are taken."

The business, which provides support including personal mobility equipment, home modification, and consumables, said it was working with the Department of Home Affairs as investigations continued.

A departmental spokesperson said Services Australia's systems remained secure and were not compromised in the attack.

"If we identify any irregular activity, we may contact customers or take other action," the spokesperson said.

"In some cases, this can include locking access to online services to prevent fraud."

The most recent data from the Australian Signals Directorate (ASD) showed a cybercrime report was made about every six minutes.

The ASD's Annual Cyber Threat Report found there were about 87,400 cybercrime reports made during 2023‚Äì24, with an average self-reported loss of $49,600 for small businesses.

Ransomware is when access to files becomes encrypted or locked, and a ransom is demanded to release the data, according to the ASD.

Cybercrime expert Saeed Akhlaghpour, whose research focuses on the healthcare sector, said health organisations, including pharmacies, GP clinics and gyms, could be easier targets for cybercriminals due to inconsistent monitoring of their operations.

"For health businesses, the stakes are higher because health data is sensitive information under Australian privacy law, and health is consistently among the most-breached sectors, representing 20 per cent of all breach notifications in the second half of 2024," he said.

"I have seen that inadequate risk management and lack of a breach response plan are recurring failure factors; simple monitoring helps close those gaps in day-to-day operations."

Dr Akhlaghpour said human error was usually the biggest factor when it came to being targeted by ransomware, with people reusing passwords and using rushed clicks when operating their systems.

He said AI tools, including systems like ChatGPT, made it easier to run campaigns at scale, including in Australia, while vulnerabilities and weak remote access could also give easy entry to hackers.

Dr Akhlaghpour said his advice to small business owners who fell victim to a ransomware attack was simple.

"Paying often does not restore data; criminals may keep a copy of the data and sell it on the dark web, and you may be targeted again.

"This aligns with the Australian government's position and emergency guidance."

articles.title: "We want to make history"- Victor Osimhen sends clear message to Atletico Madrid, Man City, after Liverpool sucker-punch - Soccernet NG
articles.description: Victor Osimhen was the star of the show, as Galatasaray shocked Liverpool at Rams Park...
articles.content:
Victor Osimhen was the star of the show, as Galatasaray shocked Liverpool at Rams Park‚Ä¶

Super Eagles striker Victor Osimhen has stated that he and his teammates are looking to make history with Galatasaray in the UEFA Champions League, Soccernet.ng reports.

Despite having to fight tooth and nail to get a win, Turkish champions Galatasaray were one of the biggest winners in the Champions League on Tuesday night.

They shocked the world by defeating Liverpool 1-0 at Rams Park. Osimhen's solitary strike from the penalty spot did the damage for the Cimbom, and he eventually took the Man of the Match Award for his effort.

Galatasaray matched everything the Reds brought to the table and looked like a well-drilled side. That result just washed away the bad taste of their opening day 5-1 bashing at Eintracht Frankfurt.

Galatasaray now have six games left to play in the group stage of the Champions League. They have games lined up against Bodo Glimt, Monaco, Ajax, Royale Union SG, Atletico Madrid, and Manchester City.

Following his impressive showing against Liverpool, Osimhen has expressed his hunger to win more games in the Champions League and go far with Galatasaray.

What Victor Osimhen Said After MotM Performance Against Liverpool

‚ÄúThis is the biggest competition in the world, and we want to go far. We really have the quality to make sure that we achieve this objective,‚Äù Victor Osimhen said. ‚ÄúIt's not going to be easy, we have to take each game as it comes. We still have some games coming, and we will be ready. We'll try to give our all to ensure that we make history with this club.‚Äù

From Osimhen‚Äôs comments, it is clear that the Super Eagles star is targeting a fine finish with Galatasaray in the Champions League.

Since the turn of the century, the Cimbom have never passed the quarterfinals of the UEFA Champions League. Perhaps, this might just be their season.

articles.title: Trump dijo que el acuerdo con Harvard est√° cerca: la universidad pagar√° USD 500 millones
articles.description: Tras meses de enfrentamientos con la Casa Blanca, una de las principales casas de estudio de Estados Unidos asume compromisos econ√≥micos y educativos que buscan resolver congelamientos de fondos
articles.content:
En medio de una fuerte tensi√≥n entre la √©lite acad√©mica y la Casa Blanca, el presidente de Estados Unidos, Donald Trump, anunci√≥ un acuerdo con la Universidad de Harvard, que abonar√° USD 500 millones y pondr√° en marcha escuelas t√©cnicas especializadas en nuevas tecnolog√≠as y oficios.

La noticia surgi√≥ el martes desde el Despacho Oval y, aunque a√∫n no fue confirmada de manera oficial por Harvard, representa un punto de inflexi√≥n tras meses de intensas disputas pol√≠ticas y judiciales entre el gobierno federal y las principales universidades estadounidenses.

Seg√∫n Reuters, el presidente explic√≥ que el acuerdo, en su fase final, contempla la supervisi√≥n directa de la secretaria de Educaci√≥n, Linda McMahon.

Trump declar√≥ ante la prensa: ‚ÄúEnse√±ar√°n inteligencia artificial, motores y muchas otras especialidades‚Äù. McMahon, presente en ese momento, asinti√≥, pero evit√≥ precisar caracter√≠sticas del entendimiento.

El anuncio, realizado durante un evento dedicado a la lucha contra el c√°ncer pedi√°trico, expuso la magnitud del cambio en la relaci√≥n entre el Gobierno y la universidad ubicada en Cambridge, Massachusetts.

CNN detall√≥ que el trasfondo del acuerdo entre la Casa Blanca y Harvard University surgi√≥ tras varios meses de negociaciones. Durante ese tiempo, funcionarios gubernamentales y representantes de la universidad debatieron las condiciones para restituir fondos federales congelados y poner fin a litigios abiertos.

La confrontaci√≥n se agudiz√≥ a inicio de a√±o, tras la reelecci√≥n de Trump, cuando el mandatario suspendi√≥ m√°s de USD 2.000 millones destinados a la investigaci√≥n en Harvard. Esta medida form√≥ parte de una ofensiva federal cuyo objetivo era forzar reformas en la gobernanza y los criterios institucionales de contrataci√≥n y ense√±anza, focaliz√°ndose en universidades identificadas como bastiones del progresismo acad√©mico.

En medio de la escalada judicial, la jueza Allison Burroughs emiti√≥ un fallo este mes que declar√≥ ilegal el intento oficial de bloquear esa cantidad de dinero en subvenciones, una decisi√≥n celebrada como ‚Äúvictoria‚Äù por Harvard.

Sin embargo, el gobierno endureci√≥ su postura: el Departamento de Salud y Servicios Humanos avanz√≥ para prohibir a la universidad concertar contratos estatales, mientras que el Departamento de Educaci√≥n la someti√≥ a un r√©gimen de ‚Äúsupervisi√≥n estricta‚Äù en materia financiera.

Frente a este escenario, fuentes cercanas a la presidencia de Harvard, liderada por Alan Garber, reconocieron un impacto econ√≥mico potencialmente devastador si las amenazas federales se concretaban. Para proteger empleos y evitar restricciones adicionales, Harvard opt√≥ por una estrategia judicial, acusando al gobierno de tomar represalias ideol√≥gicas y de vulnerar principios constitucionales fundamentales.

La decisi√≥n judicial que bloque√≥ tanto la expulsi√≥n de estudiantes internacionales como el recorte presupuestario abri√≥ paso a una instancia de acuerdo, presentada por Trump, como ‚Äúuna gran inversi√≥n en formaci√≥n t√©cnica, administrada por la universidad m√°s prestigiosa del pa√≠s‚Äù.

Finalmente, la presi√≥n federal no se limit√≥ a Harvard. Universidades como Cornell, Northwestern y la Universidad de California en Los √Ångeles (UCLA) tambi√©n enfrentaron demandas econ√≥micas significativas, con la advertencia de posibles da√±os irreparables. Ante estas exigencias, sindicatos y organizaciones de trabajadores interpusieron demandas colectivas para frenar el avance gubernamental.

articles.title: mbappe-desata-el-vendaval-hat-trick-goleada
articles.description: El Real Madrid cerr√≥ con brillantez su visita al Kairat Almaty con una goleada por 5-0 que reafirma su candidatura europea. Un Kylian Mbapp√© en estado de gracia (el franc√©s marc√≥ un hat-trick) lider√≥ la exhibici√≥n, mientras que Camavinga y Brahim redondearon el resultado. Los blancos se reivindican tras el duro golpe del derbi
articles.content:
Desde el arranque, el Real Madrid impuso su superioridad. A los 25 minutos, Kylian Mbapp√© abri√≥ el marcador desde el punto de penalti tras una falta dentro del √°rea se√±alada por el √°rbitro. El equipo kazajo intent√≥ reaccionar, pero careci√≥ de recursos ante la intensidad blanca. Las llegadas merengues fueron constantes y el dominio territorial estaba claro. El primer tiempo concluy√≥ con una m√≠nima ventaja, pero con sensaci√≥n de control absoluto para los visitantes.

Al reanudarse el juego, el Real Madrid sigui√≥ apretando y encontr√≥ continuidad ofensiva. Mbapp√© consigui√≥ su segundo gol (52¬¥) con una definici√≥n certera tras una r√°pida transici√≥n ofensiva. M√°s tarde elev√≥ su cuenta particular, logrando un hat-trick en el minuto 73, con un gran remate desde fuera del √°rea. En los minutos finales, Camavinga sum√≥ un gol de cabeza (83¬¥) y Brahim cerr√≥ la goleada en el tiempo de descuento (93¬¥), logrando el 5-0 definitivo. El equipo local intent√≥ alguna r√©plica, pero nunca tuvo el peso suficiente para inquietar en serio a la porter√≠a blanca.

Xabi Alonso apost√≥ por controlar el juego mediante dominio del mediocampo, jugar desde atr√°s con bal√≥n y aprovechar los espacios generados por la presi√≥n alta. Mbapp√© fue una opci√≥n constante en verticalidad y desbordes.

 Por otro lado, el Kairat Almaty intent√≥ resistir mediante un repliegue defensivo, pero fue incapaz de generar conexiones ofensivas que pusieran en aprietos al Real Madrid. La escasa posesi√≥n y poca profundidad fueron su principal tal√≥n de Aquiles.

El nombre propio fue Kylian Mbapp√©. El delantero franc√©s, tras un derbi gris, sac√≥ su versi√≥n m√°s letal en Europa con un hat-trick de diferentes registros: penalti, definici√≥n en transici√≥n y remate desde fuera del √°rea. Su actuaci√≥n no solo confirm√≥ su peso ofensivo, sino que tambi√©n envi√≥ un mensaje de confianza al madridismo: es el jugador llamado a marcar la diferencia en los grandes escenarios. Junto a √©l, brill√≥ Eduardo Camavinga, quien adem√°s de anotar un buen gol, domin√≥ la zona media del campo con un gran despliegue f√≠sico y recuperaciones constantes. Su capacidad de incorporarse al ataque a√±adi√≥ una dimensi√≥n extra al Real Madrid. Brahim D√≠az, autor del 5-0 en el descuento, puso la guinda al partido con su dinamismo habitual. Cada vez m√°s integrado, su rol como revulsivo se confirma como recurso clave de Xabi Alonso. La defensa, con R√ºdiger y Milit√£o, se mostr√≥ s√≥lida y sin apenas concesiones. Lunin, aunque poco exigido, transmiti√≥ seguridad en las pocas ocasiones en las que intervino. Del lado kazajo, apenas destacaron los esfuerzos aislados de su delantero centro, siempre en inferioridad. El equipo local nunca encontr√≥ la manera de inquietar a los blancos.

Implicaciones para la fase de grupos de la Champions La goleada supone un espaldarazo an√≠mico para el Real Madrid, que suma seis puntos en dos jornadas y se coloca dentro de los ocho primeros de la clasificaci√≥n. El resultado refuerza la idea de que ser√° dif√≠cil discutirle los primeros puestos. Adem√°s, la contundencia del marcador puede ser determinante en caso de empate, ya que la diferencia de goles en Champions es un factor clave. Para el Kairat Almaty, el golpe es duro: no solo perdi√≥, sino que encaj√≥ una goleada en casa. Sus opciones de clasificaci√≥n se reducen a buscar milagros en los duelos directos con el resto de equipos.

El calendario inmediato del Real Madrid es de m√°xima exigencia. En Champions League, el 22 de octubre recibir√° en el Santiago Bernab√©u a la Juventus, en lo que ser√° una aut√©ntica prueba de nivel para confirmar el liderato del grupo. En LaLiga, el equipo blanco tambi√©n tendr√° retos de gran calibre: el 4 de octubre recibir√° al Villarreal, el 19 de octubre visitar√° al Getafe y el 26 de octubre llega la cita m√°s esperada, el Cl√°sico frente al FC Barcelona en el Santiago Bernab√©u. Un tramo de calendario que obligar√° a Xabi Alonso a gestionar esfuerzos sin perder competitividad.

articles.title: Campanha recebe de volta imagem de Santo Elesb√£o furtada h√° 31 anos do Museu Regional
articles.description: Pe√ßa sacra foi furtada em 1994 junto a outras 27 imagens; cinco j√° retornaram ao acervo do Museu Regional.
articles.content:
Obra furtada h√° 31 anos √© entregue durante cerim√¥nia em Campanha

A cidade de Campanha , no Sul de Minas, viveu uma noite hist√≥rica nesta ter√ßa-feira (30). A imagem de Santo Elesb√£o, furtada do Museu Regional em 1994, foi recuperada ap√≥s 31 anos e entregue oficialmente ao munic√≠pio.

A cerim√¥nia de devolu√ß√£o aconteceu em frente √† Catedral de Santo Ant√¥nio, no Centro da cidade, e contou com a participa√ß√£o de quatro grupos de ternos de Congadas, al√©m de representantes do Minist√©rio P√∫blico e da Prefeitura. A presen√ßa do santo est√° diretamente ligada √†s Irmandades Negras, que mant√™m viva a tradi√ß√£o congadeira h√° mais de dois s√©culos na regi√£o.

O Museu Regional de Campanha foi alvo de furto em 7 de mar√ßo de 1994, quando 28 obras sacras foram levadas. Desde ent√£o, parte do acervo vem sendo gradualmente recuperada. Com a devolu√ß√£o da imagem de Santo Elesb√£o, cinco pe√ßas j√° retornaram ao museu.

1 de 2 Campanha recebe de volta imagem de Santo Elesb√£o furtada h√° 31 anos do Museu Regional ‚Äî Foto: Reprodu√ß√£o EPTV Campanha recebe de volta imagem de Santo Elesb√£o furtada h√° 31 anos do Museu Regional ‚Äî Foto: Reprodu√ß√£o EPTV

Segundo o Minist√©rio P√∫blico de Minas Gerais, a recupera√ß√£o faz parte do trabalho do Sondar, sistema de resgate de bens culturais. A imagem foi localizada em outra regi√£o do pa√≠s ‚Äî o estado n√£o foi divulgado. O processo de identifica√ß√£o envolveu an√°lises t√©cnicas e compara√ß√£o com fichas de invent√°rio do museu.

‚ÄúA partir do momento que essa informa√ß√£o chegou para n√≥s, realizamos estudos e pesquisas minuciosas para confirmar a autenticidade. As informa√ß√µes convergiram e permitiram uma an√°lise robusta, com registros fotogr√°ficos e descri√ß√µes detalhadas‚Äù, explicou a historiadora e restauradora do MPMG, Paula Carolina Miranda Novais.

‚ÄúReceber essa quinta imagem recuperada das 28 que foram furtadas em 1994 √© motivo de muita alegria. Estamos reunindo os ternos de Congado para festejar Santo Elesb√£o, um santo devotado pelos escravos. √â um dia festivo e de agradecimento a todos que ajudaram na recupera√ß√£o dessa imagem‚Äù, afirmou.

2 de 2 Campanha recebe de volta imagem de Santo Elesb√£o furtada h√° 31 anos do Museu Regional ‚Äî Foto: Eduardo Marins/EPTV Campanha recebe de volta imagem de Santo Elesb√£o furtada h√° 31 anos do Museu Regional ‚Äî Foto: Eduardo Marins/EPTV

A pe√ßa seguir√° agora para o Museu Regional de Arte Sacra, onde ficar√° ao lado da imagem de Santa Efig√™nia, considerada semelhante por ser produzida pelo mesmo artista. O espa√ßo passou por reformas e hoje conta com sistema de monitoramento 24 horas, em parceria com as pol√≠cias Militar e Civil.

Apesar das cinco devolu√ß√µes, ainda faltam 23 pe√ßas sacras levadas em 1994. Quem tiver informa√ß√µes pode entrar em contato com o Minist√©rio P√∫blico de Minas Gerais, pelo telefone (31) 3250-4620, ou com o IEPHA/MG, nos n√∫meros (31) 3235-2812 e (31) 3235-2813.

articles.title: Halle Berry's latest social media post has fans calling her 'finest woman in the world' after bikini photo
articles.description: Halle Berry posted a photo of herself from behind in a black-and-white bikini as she walks off on a hillside, with fans complimenting her ageless figure.
articles.content:
Halle Berry wowed fans with a new bikini picture on social media.

The 59-year-old "Monster's Ball" actress shared a cheeky photo on Instagram, featuring her in a black-and-white string Monday Swimwear bikini as she walked away from the camera toward a hillside.

"Looks like I‚Äôm going the wrong way, but I‚Äôm not‚Ä¶just going my own way !" she captioned the photo.

Fans were quick to flood the comments section with praise for the actress, with one writing, "After all these years this woman is still the finest woman in the worldüåπüòç."

HALLE BERRY STUNS WITH SWIMSUIT PHOTOS WHILE ON DESERT VACATION

Another added, "A true timeless beauty that will never age in Ms @halleberry."

Others were happy with the message the star left for her fans in the caption. "Big Leo Energy! We are going to It our ‚Äòown way‚Äô for sure. üî•," one fan wrote, while another added, "Heavy on ‚Äòown way‚Äô not their way ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ú®‚ú®."

Berry recently celebrated her 59th birthday while vacationing on a tropical island, marking the occasion with a series of bikini pictures. She posted multiple photos in a gold two-piece, including some of her sipping a drink out of a coconut, and another of her smiling from ear to ear.

LIKE WHAT YOU‚ÄôRE READING? CLICK HERE FOR MORE ENTERTAINMENT NEWS

Other photos from her vacation feature her with her boyfriend, Van Hunt, whom she has been with since 2020. In the photo, the two can be seen lying in bed together and eating a bowl of chips, as she sports a white bikini.

"The minute I started to feel like I understood myself and what I had been doing wrong, Van‚Äôs brother, who I had known for many years, came to me and said, ‚ÄòYou should meet my brother,'" she told Marie Claire in September 2024. "The nature of the way this happened, I have a real belief that this is it. This is my person."

Hunt and Berry confirmed their relationship through a social media post shared on Berry's Instagram, in which she wore a black T-shirt with Hunt's name on it, captioning the post, "now ya know... ‚ô•Ô∏èü¶∂üèΩ."

Prior to her relationship with Hunt, Berry was married three times. She married former professional baseball player, David Justice, from 1993 to 1997, and later Eric Ben√©t from 2001 to 2005. She was then married to French actor, Olivier Martinez, with whom she shares her son Maceo, 11, from 2013 to 2016. She also shares daughter Nahla, 17, with her ex-boyfriend, Gabriel Aubry.

"I‚Äôve heard people say, 'Something must be wrong with Halle Berry, she can‚Äôt keep a man.' Who's to say I want to keep a man?" she said on "The Drew Barrymore Show" in February 2025. "I don‚Äôt want to keep the wrong man. Like, I‚Äôm not crazy, right? So when you find that you make a mistake ‚Äî we all make mistakes. We have a right to say, ‚ÄòOh God, this was a mistake. Let me start again.‚Äô We have the right to do that."

articles.title: Capitol Report Full Broadcast (Sept. 30)
articles.description: Trump also announced that a major pharmaceutical company will be cutting drug costs, and a website called TrumpRx, offering direct-to-consumer prescription drugs,...
articles.content:
President Donald Trump, speaking to top military brass, says America is being invaded from within‚Äîcomparing the issue to a foreign enemy. That comes as he calls for increased defense spending and higher military combat standards.

Trump also announced that a major pharmaceutical company will be cutting drug costs, and a website called TrumpRx, offering direct-to-consumer prescription drugs, will be launched. Here's how this might impact what you pay for prescription drugs.

With fewer than five hours until a government shutdown, federal agencies brace for layoffs of thousands of workers. Why do we keep finding ourselves facing a government shutdown? We'll break it down with former U.S. Rep. Bob Good.

Our panel tonight debates how the new military standards will impact fighting readiness. Plus, how significant is the drug pricing deal for Americans who rely on treatment? We'll discuss with Madeline Summerville and Whitley Yates.

Trump is activating 200 members of the Oregon National Guard amid protests against ICE. Now, Oregon officials are asking a judge to block the National Guard. How could this play out legally? We'll break it down with constitutional attorney Chris Murray.

A Senate committee today heard witness testimony about a screening program designed to mitigate terrorism that‚Äôs allegedly being used to surveil ordinary Americans. We have more details on that program.

And the president says he's giving Hamas "three or four days" to accept the new plan to end the war in the Gaza Strip. Meanwhile, Israel vows to finish the job if the terrorist group doesn‚Äôt accept the plan.

articles.title: JPMorgan tips shutdown lasting up to two weeks, warns of market disruption
articles.description: JPMorgan sees 70% chance U.S. government shutdown drags on 11‚Äì15 days
articles.content:
JPMorgan has assigned a 70% probability that the looming U.S. government shutdown will drag on for between 11 and 15 days, putting markets on notice for a protracted disruption. The bank said the duration is consistent with recent historical precedent and would likely delay key economic data releases, complicating the Federal Reserve‚Äôs policy outlook.

Analysts cautioned that even a short shutdown could rattle investor confidence, while a two-week stoppage risks feeding into fiscal growth headwinds just as markets debate the Fed‚Äôs pace of interest rate cuts. The uncertainty may heighten sensitivity around upcoming private-sector data, such as PMI surveys, which remain unaffected by federal closures.
‚Ä¢ Trump says good will come from shutdown, going to be laying off a lot of people

articles.title: Festival de √ìpera: un volantazo de jazz fresco sobre 'Carmen'
articles.description: 'Carmen' cant√≥ y bail√≥ sobre ritmos cl√°sicos, pero sobre todo al paso del jazz, con m√∫sicos de primera y un sentido compositivo de Salim que se encuentra pocas veces, sobre un hombre sencillo, humano y adorable.
articles.content:
Si llevamos dos t√≠tulos sevillanos, casi estrenos, del compositor Manuel Garc√≠a, recuperando su m√∫sica que mira estil√≠sticamente a Mozart, pero que se hace mayor en N√°poles, siguiendo los pasos de la √≥pera bufa, y a la que el compositor le a√±ade su arraigo espa√±ol (Sevilla, C√°diz o Madrid, como la tirana de 'Quien porf√≠a mucho alcanza'), la m√∫sica ahora daba un giro, porque tambi√©n 'Carmen' se puede inspirar en la m√∫sica espa√±ola (de hecho, Bizet cre√≠a que la m√∫sica de la 'Habanera' era un canto popular espa√±ol, y no de Sebasti√°n Iradier), o pasodobles como el del toreador, la seguidilla de Carmen, etc.

Esa m√∫sica que busca lo popular se estiliza en Bizet y de ah√≠ vuelve 'a la calle' de manos de un m√∫sico que no renuncia a ella, pero conoce el lenguaje cl√°sico, tanto de la composici√≥n como del piano, y de su padre le viene la vena jazz√≠stica. Es dif√≠cil que junt√°ndolo todo saliese algo mal. Y eso que reconoc√≠a que el experimento quedaba lejos de lo que el quinteto suele hacer.

El inicio corri√≥ a cargo del bater√≠a -un pasaje algo largo- y luego se fueron a√±adiendo los miembros del grupo, que entonaron el comienzo de la 'Seguidilla' y al un√≠sono la idea principal de este tema de apertura, todo en un estilo que dir√≠amos 'dixie'. Pero lo que no esper√°bamos eran unas sevillanas con todas sus partes bien marcadas (dir√≠amos que hasta se podr√≠an bailar), si bien las armon√≠as y las melod√≠as se distanciaban algo m√°s. Aqu√≠ el experimento ya esperanzaba todo lo que seguir√≠a.

El siguiente tema reca√≠a en la trompeta, un momento √≠ntimo, corto, pero quiz√° para contrastar con el esc√°ndalo de los dos temas anteriores. Porque digamos que la amplificaci√≥n parec√≠a hecha para un teatro con el doble de capacidad. Decimos siempre que flamenco y jazz son incapaces de actuar sin micros: aqu√≠ hab√≠a cuatro instrumentos muy poderosos y si acaso se pod√≠a haber reforzado algo el contrabajo, que a lo mejor tampoco, con la ac√∫stica del Turina. Vale, se amplifica (que, por cierto estuvo muy lograda, equilibrada, diferenciando timbres y lo que se quiera): ¬øpero hace falta ese volumen, al l√≠mite de lo que puede aguantar el o√≠do humano? Bueno, pues un descansito para la oreja y un gustazo tambi√©n por la elegancia y el buen gusto del trompetista.

Record√≥ Salim la presencia de 'Carmen' por el 150 aniversario, y titul√≥ el siguiente tema 'Hasta luego, Mari Carmen', eligiendo un trabajo sobre la 'Habanera'‚Ä¶ a ritmo de salsa de La Habana, claro, que volv√≠a a subir el volumen y la temperatura. De pronto un corte radical, y una magistral improvisaci√≥n pian√≠stica sobre un delicado 'ostinato' de trompeta y tromb√≥n, en permanente estado de gracia.

Sigui√≥ el pianista en una afectiva introducci√≥n, que preparaba la versi√≥n del aria de las cartas, en el fondo un enorme 'crescendo' al ir uni√©ndosele todos los instrumentos, con el final salvaje de la bater√≠a -imaginamos que por el anuncio de la muerte de Carmen-, donde los decibelios que sobraban pod√≠an haberse dado al p√∫blico en un tupper aparte, para terminar de o√≠rlos en casa o en el campo.

Menos mal que no hubo tiempo para quejas, porque sali√≥ el Salim virtuoso, con una introducci√≥n de saltos interv√°licos continuos, escalas por terceras o acordes enlazados por cromatismos descendentes. Aqu√≠ confirmamos que en las escalas m√°s r√°pidas recurre al estilo de los clavecinistas barrocos, que hac√≠an las escalas con tres o cuatro dedos. El dedo peque√±o lo reserva para los acordes (a veces improvisa con ellos). Continu√≥ con un momento muy especial: bater√≠a y trombonista se arrancaron por Alegr√≠as, primero s√≥lo con las palmas y luego -y ah√≠ la sorpresa- con Pablo Mart√≠nez cant√°ndolas, y con qu√© gusto. Aplauso de los grandes para este gran momento.

Volviendo abundantemente a 'Carmen', nos ofrecieron un 'rebujito', que empez√≥ por ese momento tremendo del d√∫o final, 'Tu ne m'aimes plus?' con un potente intervenci√≥n del contrabajo, la trompeta, el tromb√≥n y la bater√≠a, terminando con el coro que precede a la habanera, donde los hombres le cantan a Carmen 'dis-nous quel jour tu nous aimeras!', terminando con brillantez el popurr√≠.

Por √∫ltimo, el aria del toreador dio pie a otra improvisaci√≥n de Salim sobre la conocida canci√≥n, en la que nos hizo participar el pianista, as√≠ como a los metales mientras √©l manten√≠a con el bajo una progresi√≥n crom√°tica descendente, enlazando con 'les triangles des sistres'. La √∫nica propina fue una sentida balada dedicada a su madre.

'Carmen' ha dado lugar a muchas versiones y sus temas se han versionado de mil maneras, pero creemos que esta visi√≥n amplia, divertida a veces, recogida y sentida otras, es un gran trabajo de alguien que combina con cabeza la improvisaci√≥n y la composici√≥n. Cuando el p√∫blico le segu√≠a insistiendo al final que tocaran otra, Salim explic√≥ de coraz√≥n que no hab√≠a compuesto m√°s sobre Carmen. Pod√≠a haber cogido cualquier fragmento conocido y haber montado una improvisaci√≥n con todos los m√∫sicos, pero la composici√≥n ocupa una parte tan importante en su obra como la invenci√≥n sobre la marcha.

articles.title: Smilegate's game platform stove is a discount event for the Chuseok ho
articles.description: Smilegate announced that it will hold a large-scale fall discount event 'LOL 2025' on its global game platform 'Stove' for the Chuseok holiday.'Hahaha' is a n
articles.content:
Smilegate's game platform stove is a discount event for the Chuseok holiday lol 2025 promotion will be held





Smilegate announced that it will hold a large-scale fall discount event 'LOL 2025' on its global game platform 'Stove' for the Chuseok holiday.



'Hahaha' is a name that contains the meaning of 'Hangawi and Han Ah-reum' on Hangeul Day, and the promotion runs until October 12. During this period, Smilegate will provide a variety of programs, including coupon payments by order, free distribution of games, special offers for famous titles, and prize events.









First of all, during the event, Smilegate offers 'LOL Coupon' which offers up to 25% off on a total of four occasions. On top of that, users who add friends to the stove Kakao Talk channel will be sent an additional 5% duplicate coupon from October 1st to 12th. In commemoration of Hangeul Day, a 15% discount coupon for the stove Koreanization title will also be provided separately from the 9th to the 12th.



Smilegate also allowed anyone to play the healing puzzle game 'Blue Wednesday' and the emotional puzzle adventure 'Lynn, the girl's story drawn in the puzzle' through the 'Stove Is 0 Won' event.



Stove's regular discount event 'Big Deal' will be transformed into 'Knuri' in time for this holiday. In the event, which means 'Big Enuri' in pure Korean, users can purchase the selected popular title at a discount of up to 98%. According to the company, Stove's latest Korean translation titles, such as `The Hungry Lamb' and 'Dark Date 2' will be offered at the lowest price ever, ranging from 'Clair Opsquir: 33 Expeditionary Force', 'Artis Impact' and 'Artis Impact' and three kinds of Quantic Dreams (Detroit: Beacom Human, Beyond to Souls and Heavy Rain).

articles.title: Tras reuni√≥n con Porras, Congreso aprueba en segundo debate ley para declarar a pandillas como terroristas
articles.description: El Congreso de la Rep√∫blica conoci√≥ en su segundo debate la iniciativa de ley que propone declarar a pandillas como terroristas.
articles.content:
Este martes 30 de septiembre, el Congreso de la Rep√∫blica aprob√≥ en segundo debate la iniciativa de ley 5692, propuesta por el expresidente Alejandro Giammattei, que propone reformas al C√≥digo Procesal Penal y C√≥digo Penal para declarar a las pandillas y maras como organizaciones terroristas.

La iniciativa de ley fue aprobada en segundo debate, luego de una reuni√≥n entre miembros de la Junta Directiva del Congreso, jefes de bloque y la fiscal general y jefa del Ministerio P√∫blico (MP), en la cual el ente investigador present√≥ varias propuestas para la iniciativa 5692.

Durante la sesi√≥n plenaria, el congresista Gustavo Cruz propuso una moci√≥n para que se conociera como primer punto en la agenda la iniciativa de ley 5692, sin embargo, no logr√≥ los votos necesarios.

Sin embargo, el proyecto de ley que proponer declarar a las pandillas como organizaciones terroristas, fue conocido en segundo debate, como se ten√≠a previsto en la agenda.

En enero de 2020, Giammattei present√≥ el proyecto de ley 5692 que busca aprobar reformas al C√≥digo Penal, adicionar el art√≠culo 391 Bis, el cual quedaba de la siguiente forma:

‚ÄúArt√≠culo 391 Bis. Terrorismo con fines de desorden p√∫blico social. Quien con el prop√≥sito de transgredir la paz social o el orden p√∫blico del Estado, se organice, constituya o pertenezca a grupos criminales caracterizados por su territorialidad, alta criminalidad y simbolog√≠a, ejecutare actos contra la vida, integridad, seguridad y bienes de las personas, da√±e o se apropie injustamente de propiedad privada o p√∫blica, atente contra la salud p√∫blica o la seguridad ciudadana, realice acciones intimidatorias o de coacci√≥n de forma p√∫blica con finalidad patrimonial en contra de persona individual y jur√≠dica, comercio, ser√° sancionado con prisi√≥n de seis a doce a√±os inconmutables, sin perjuicio de las penas asignadas o los delitos cometidos.

Igual sanci√≥n corresponder√° a quienes promuevan, financien o se beneficien directamente de las actividades que realicen estos grupos criminales.

La pena se aumentar√° en una tercera parte a los jefes, cabecillas, l√≠deres o dirigentes de estos grupos criminales.

A los condenados por la comisi√≥n de este delito, no podr√° conced√©rseles rebaja de la pena, por ninguna causa‚Äù.

Sin embargo, la Comisi√≥n de Asuntos de Seguridad Nacional dio dictamen favorable a la propuesta con m√°s de 20 art√≠culos que reforman el C√≥digo Penal, la Ley contra la delincuencia Organizada, al mismo tiempo que crea mesas interinstitucionales para el combate a las maras.

Entre otros temas, la iniciativa espec√≠fica que las maras son grupos de tres o m√°s personas que existen con el objetivo de cometer delitos y se organizan en una estructura jer√°rquica con liderazgo defino, en grupos y subgrupos com√∫nmente llamados ‚Äúclicas‚Äù, al mismo tiempo que reconocen y manifiestan una identidad grupal con c√≥digos y se√±ales propias.

Tambi√©n, resalta que estas organizaciones criminales establecen su territorio por medio de s√≠mbolos o marcas, pero sus actividades no se reducen a estos lugares. A su vez, detalla que buscan lucrarse.

Adem√°s, la normativa establece que se declarar√° la actividad delictiva de las maras como de ¬´alta peligrosidad¬ª.

El diputado Gustavo Cruz cuestion√≥ que se aprob√≥ un ‚Äúpiropo‚Äù con el punto resolutivo que exhorta al presidente Bernardo Ar√©valo para que nombre a las maras como terroristas, por lo cual propuso alterar el orden del d√≠a para que se conociera como primer punto la iniciativa de ley 5692.

La diputada oficialista Andrea Reyes indic√≥ que se conociera como punto primero la iniciativa de ley 5692. Seg√∫n explic√≥, la Comisi√≥n hizo lo mejor que pudo para rescatar el ‚Äúmamarracho‚Äù que present√≥ el gobierno de Alejandro Giammattei, pero que, pese a ello, presentar√≠an distintas mociones.

Al mismo tiempo, la oficialista, Victoria Palala, propuso que no camine la iniciativa de ley 5692, y que se cree la mesa t√©cnica presidencial propuesta por el presidente del Congreso, Nery Ramos.

A su vez, el diputado de Vamos, Ronald Portillo Cord√≥n, expuso que el oficialismo se ha opuesto a proyectos de ley como la iniciativa 5692, por lo cual afirm√≥ que se oponen a ‚Äúdeclarar a estas organizaciones criminales como lo que realmente son: son organizaciones terroristas‚Äù.

Tambi√©n, Elmer Palencia, de la bancada Valor, sostuvo que propuso en distintas ocasiones que se declaren como terroristas a las pandillas, y que se puede exponer a los diputados que votaron en contra.

‚ÄúTuvo que llegar el momento en que se conociera por parte del gobierno de Estados Unidos y se hiciera la designaci√≥n para que volviera a entrar de nuevo en discusi√≥n el tema‚Äù, indic√≥.

Palencia a√±adi√≥ que el Congreso puede aprobar todos los decretos que puedan, pero lamentablemente el Ejecutivo no cumple con lo que la ley establece.

Sin embargo, la propuesta fue rechazada por el pleno, por lo cual, el diputado Gustavo Cruz cuestion√≥ que se aprob√≥ el punto resolutivo con 92 votos que exhorta a Ar√©valo declarar a las pandillas como terroristas, pero solamente hubo 63 votos para conocer como punto primero la iniciativa de ley 5692.

El diputado de Vamos, Allan Rodr√≠guez, explic√≥ que votaron en contra de que se conociera como primer punto la iniciativa 5692, ya que se deb√≠a conocerse durante el punto 5 A de la agenda, como se estableci√≥ en la instancia de jefe de bloques.

De igual forma, se√±al√≥ que diputados oficialistas han salido en defensa de la mara, ya que tienen una relaci√≥n con el gobierno de M√©xico.

‚ÄúLa alianza del gobierno con los grupos delincuenciales con las maras es realmente evidente, y se pudieron ello dar cuenta que quienes custodiaban los centros de votaci√≥n eran los mareros, quienes llevaban las personas a votar en los mareros‚Äù, indic√≥.

‚ÄúEllos al igual, estos diputados independientes, al igual que en M√©xico, con ese discurso de preferimos abrazos y no balazos, buscan realmente beneficiar a las maras (‚Ä¶) hoy con un discurso buscan lavarse la cara‚Äù, indic√≥ Rodr√≠guez, quien record√≥ que la iniciativa fue propuesta por Vamos.

A su vez, Byron Rodr√≠guez, del bloque Todos, sostiene que las reformas al C√≥digo Penal y C√≥digo Procesal Penal que propone la ley 5692, se deben de conocer ahondar ampliamente y tiene que tener un estudio jur√≠dico t√©cnico, por diversas razones, incluyendo que Ley de Aceptaci√≥n de Cargos ha complicado la situaci√≥n en diversos temas.

Tambi√©n, se√±al√≥ que se debe reformar el C√≥digo Penal, pero no ¬´parcharlo¬ª, ya que se debe encontrar un mecanismo para que quienes financian a los cabecillas y quienes se benefician en temas pol√≠ticos, empresariales, y lavado de dinero tengan conductas penales y tipos penales que no permitan que salgan de prisi√≥n.

El pasado 29 de septiembre, Porras sostuvo una reuni√≥n con jefes de bloque, luego que el Congreso aprobara un punto resolutivo en el que ped√≠a al Ejecutivo designar a la Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) y el Barrio 18 como organizaciones terroristas, y ped√≠a a la Fiscal√≠a investigar las fuentes de financiamiento de los grupos criminales.

Durante la reuni√≥n, el MP present√≥ propuestas a la iniciativa de ley 5692, presentada por el gobierno de Giammattei, con el fin de que se reforme la Ley de Equipos de Terminales M√≥viles, el C√≥digo Procesal Penal y la Ley Contra la Delincuencia Organizada.

A la reuni√≥n se present√≥, el primer vicepresidente de la Junta Directiva, Jorge Castro; el segundo vicepresidente, Jorge Estuardo Ayala; as√≠ como el segundo secretario, Mario Ernesto G√°lvez Mu√±oz; tercer secretario, Juan Carlos Rivera; y el quinto secretario, Jos√© Pablo Mendoza Franco.

Tambi√©n, participaron los diputados de Vamos, Allan Rodr√≠guez y Sergio Arana; de Unionista, √Ålvaro Arz√∫ Escobar; de la Unidad Nacional de la Esperanza (UNE), In√©s Castillo y Julio Marroqu√≠n; de Nosotros, Nadia de Le√≥n; de Comunidad Elefante, Alexandra Ajcip; de Valor, Elmer Palencia; de Cambio, Esduin Javier y Javier ‚ÄúTres Kiebres‚Äù; de Azul, Jorge Mario Villagr√°n; y de Todos, Cornelio Gonzalo Garc√≠a Garc√≠a.

articles.title: No panic but Liverpool have to improve, says Van Dijk
articles.description: ISTANBUL - Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk called for improvement and an end to silly errors after his side went down 1-0 at Galatasaray in the Champions League on Tuesday and suffered the loss of goalkeeper Alisson to injury. Read more at straitstimes. Read more at straitstimes.
articles.content:
ISTANBUL - Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk called for improvement and an end to silly errors after his side went down 1-0 at Galatasaray in the Champions League on Tuesday and suffered the loss of goalkeeper Alisson to injury.

The defeat was Liverpool's second in a row after the Premier League leaders lost their 100% record at Crystal Palace last Saturday.

"I hate losing. There shouldn't be panic, but there should be definitely improvement needed," the Dutch centre back said on Amazon Prime.

"I think it was a big step up in terms of the willingness, the hard work that we put in from the weekend, but that was not really too difficult because the weekend was just bad.

"We have to convert chances, don't give a penalty away today and don't make stupid mistakes at times. It's far too easy to say these things than to actually make it happen but it's a process and we have to keep going.

"Keep working, stick together and onto the next one. That's the only thing we can focus on."

Liverpool lost out to an early penalty, slotted home by Victor Osimhen, in a game played in an intimidating cauldron of a stadium after fireworks had been let off outside the team hotel overnight.

Manager Arne Slot said he was disappointed but the performance was still a lot better than last Saturday and it all came down to fine margins, with the team not so far off last season's level.

"We've lost now twice in a row, this is something with the schedule coming as well. Galatasaray away is not an easy game, the same like Palace, and now we play Chelsea away so difficult games," he explained.

"I saw a lot of things. First half, the way we played, the way we controlled the game, the amount of times we got our attackers in promising positions.

"In the second half, that was much less. But I don't think in the second half there was a lot of playing time. Their striker was four or five times on the floor, substitutions, injuries."

Alisson's loss, with the goalkeeper ruled out of Saturday's game at Chelsea, is a big one and Liverpool also had Hugo Ekitike go off injured.

With record signing Alexander Isak still not up to match fitness, but coming on as a second-half substitute along with Mohamed Salah, and some new players yet to gel Liverpool can ill afford to lose a scoring talent like Ekitike.

Salah's form is also a concern, with the Egyptian last starting a Champions League game on the bench three years ago and making little impact when he came on. REUTERS

articles.title: Starmer significantly more popular than Farage in head-to-head polling - LabourList
articles.description: When head to head Starmer and Labour prefered to Farage and Reform by a significant majority.
articles.content:
Polling for the Fabian Society conducted by YouGov and shared exclusively with LabourList shows that if given a choice between Keir Starmer and Nigel Farage to be Prime Minister, voters opted for the former by a margin of 45 ‚Äì 33% (with 22% saying ‚Äòdon‚Äôt know‚Äô).

This number is even larger among the voters who opted for Labour in 2024 but are not supporting the party now with Starmer at 71% vs Farage on 23% (with only 5 per cent saying ‚Äòdon‚Äôt know‚Äô). This rises even higher to 95% for Starmer over Farage when it comes to those who voted Labour in 2024 but are now saying they support either the Green Party or the Lib Dems.

When given a choice between Labour and Reform as the party of government, with no other parties on offer, the overall public opted for Labour by 46% to 34% for Reform UK ‚Äì a lead of 11 points. This rises again to 71% for Labour and 25% for Reform for those who voted Labour at the last election but would not now and again to 95% for those who now support either Green or Lib Dem.

All figures, unless otherwise stated, are from YouGov Plc. Total sample size was 2,220 adults. Fieldwork was undertaken between 24th ‚Äì 25th September 2025. The survey was carried out online. The figures have been weighted and are representative of all GB adults (aged 18+).

Editor of LabourList, Emma Burnell, said: ‚ÄúThe figures show that it is clear that while Nigel Farage might lead in the polls when there are many parties on offer, he repels more voters than he attracts.

‚ÄúLabour should make sure that their offer is attractive enough to all voters who would be willing to opt for them to stop Farage and Reform forming a government. These voters will need wooing as much as those who are currently attracted to the populist right wing policies of Reform.‚Äù

Subscribe here to our daily newsletter roundup of Labour news, analysis and comment‚Äì and follow us on Bluesky, WhatsApp, X and Facebook.

Ben Cooper of the Fabian Society said: ‚ÄúDespite a difficult first year, the Prime Minister and Labour remain far more popular amongst voters than the alternative of Farage and Reform.

‚ÄúThere is a broad voter coalition open to backing Labour at the next election, and ready to reject the politics of division being peddled by Farage. However, it cannot be assumed this coalition will turn out for Labour.

‚ÄúBy focusing on their priorities, Starmer‚Äôs conference speech can be the first step to rebuilding the coalition, and winning a second term.‚Äù

Share your thoughts. Contribute on this story or tell your own by writing to our Editor. The best letters every week will be published on the site. Find out how to get your letter published.

Dr Patrick English of YouGov said: ‚ÄúThe evidence from this poll suggests that while Reform UK are ahead in the vote intention polls, significantly more Brits would prefer a Labour government and a Starmer premiership over Reform UK and Nigel Farage.

‚ÄúBut a national, binary choice is of course not how our voting system works. The challenge for Labour will be convincing these voters to turn out and back them at the next election in sufficient numbers, and in the right areas, to see off the challenge from a motivated and fired up Reform party.‚Äù

articles.title: Encuentro Las Independientes une desde ma√±ana a editores, gestores culturales y libreros en Guayaquil, en el MAAC
articles.description: La primera actividad es el mi√©rcoles 1 a las 10:00, un di√°logo sobre la literatura ecuatoriana del siglo XXI.
articles.content:
Editores independientes, gestores culturales, libreros, fanzineros y diversos actores del libro se congregar√°n del mi√©rcoles 1 al domingo 5 de octubre en el Museo Antropol√≥gico y de Arte Contempor√°neo (MAAC) para la feria Las Independientes.

Es una propuesta de Libre Libro, Otra Orilla y Furia Fanzine que se desarrollar√° de 10:00 a 20:00 en el lobby del MAAC (Malec√≥n y Loja); quiere ofrecer ‚Äúencuentros inesperados‚Äù con libros que no est√°n en las estanter√≠as habituales, y mostrar tambi√©n al circuito completo de la industria editorial, todos los que rodean al autor. Y con el fanzine, ese movimiento de publicaci√≥n autogestionada, independiente y no censurada.

La programaci√≥n estar√° conformada por di√°logos, talleres y la feria comercial de libreros, editores y agentes culturales. M√°s de 30 expositores de todo el pa√≠s, dos invitados internacionales y ocho autores locales estar√°n all√≠.

A Las Independientes llegar√° el mexicano Tonatiuh Trejo, quien lidera el proyecto Esto es un libro (s√°bado 4 a las 16:00).

El homenajeado de esta edici√≥n ser√° el poeta, novelista y cuentista guayaquile√±o Rafael D√≠az Icaza (1925-2013).

Adem√°s fue periodista, profesor y editor, y est√° en el centenario de su nacimiento. De esto hablar√°n Sonia Manzano y √Ångel Emilio Hidalgo el jueves 2 a las 18:00.

El primer conversatorio ser√° el mi√©rcoles 1 a las 10:00 en el auditorio: ‚ÄòBastardos: Di√°logo sobre la literatura ecuatoriana del siglo XXI‚Äô, con √Ångel Dar√≠o Jim√©nez, Roberto Ram√≠rez, Solange Rodr√≠guez, Mar√≠a Mercedes Salgado y Mar√≠a Cecilia Velasco.

Le seguir√° la charla magistral que inaugurar√° oficialmente Las Independientes, a las 11:30: ‚ÄòTransformaciones contempor√°neas de la industria editorial argentina‚Äô, de la soci√≥loga, docente e investigadora de la Universidad de Buenos Aires Anal√≠a Goldentul.

Y a las 16:00 habr√° en la cafeter√≠a un ‚ÄòCuadril√°tero de libros‚Äô, enfrentamiento con ring y r√©feri entre tres actores del mundo creativo: el escritor Mart√≠n Cad√©s, el ilustrador Dami√°n Matailo y la escritora y artista visual Paula Barona.

Y Jessica Zambrano entrevistar√° a las 18:00 al m√∫sico Pedro Bomfim (Lolab√∫m) sobre ‚ÄòEscrituras y sonoridades‚Äô.

La cartelera completa est√° en las redes del MAAC. (F)

articles.title: Bayern M√∫nich no deja espacio para las dudas y golea al Pafos
articles.description: Bayern M√∫nich no dej√≥ espacio alguno para las dudas y ratific√≥ su favoritismo ante el Pafos con una goleada por 1-5 en la Liga de Campeones.
articles.content:
El Bayern M√∫nich no dej√≥ espacio alguno para las dudas y ratific√≥ su favoritismo ante el Pafos con una goleada por 1-5 en la Liga de Campeones con lo que sigue contando sus partidos por victorias.

El club b√°varo dej√≥ el partido visto para sentencia en la primera parte y en la segunda se dio el lujo de bajar un poco las revoluciones.

Las posibles dudas que hubiera podido haber con respecto al desarrollo del encuentro se acabaron en el minuto 15 cuando Harry Kane marc√≥ el primer gol del Bayern, con un remate de primera al segundo poste a pase de Michael Olise.

En el 20 Rapahel Guerreiro hizo el segundo con un remate desde cerca tras una pared con Nicholas Jackson, autor del tercero en el 31, al rematar dentro del √°rea un pase de Olise.

La euforia inicial del club chipriota, que hab√≠a tenido incluso el primer remate con direcci√≥n a puerta en el minuto 5 por intermedio de Pepe, empez√≥ a diluirse. Cuando una galopada de Jaja en el 33, que termin√≥ con un remate a los brazos de Manuel Neuer, volvi√≥ a despertar un poco la tribuna el cuarto del Bayern lleg√≥ a vuelta de correo marcado por Kane.

Sin embargo, el primer tiempo tuvo un final relativamente bals√°mico para el Pafos con un gran gol de Orsic que derrot√≥ a Neuer con un remate desde fuera del √°rea que se col√≥ por la escuadra tras una p√©rdida de bal√≥n de Minjae Kim.

Al comienzo de la segunda parte el Pafos tuvo una buena ocasi√≥n con un cabezazo de Goldar en un saque de esquina, pero las llegadas del Bayern, aunque no eran tan frecuentes como en la primera mitad, apuntaban al quinto gol. Y √©ste llego en el 68, marcado por Olise al aprovechar un rebote tras un remate de Jackson.

En la segunda parte el Bayern baj√≥ la intensidad. Los cambios -Luis D√≠az se qued√≥ en el vestuario, Kane sali√≥ en el 64 y Olise 73- tambi√©n restaron poder ofensivo. Sin embargo, hubo ocasiones para el sexto, Jackon y Serge Gnabry estrellaron sendos disparos en los postes. Pero la prioridad parec√≠a ser reservar fuerzas para las tareas por venir tanto en la Bundesliga como en la Liga de Campeones.

articles.title: Dusty May sees early progress on turnovers, three-point shooting
articles.description: Ten minutes after each practice, Dusty May is handed a stat sheet. Given last year, there are two stats that his eyes are immediately drawn to. ‚ÄúThe first thing I look at is assist-to-turnover ratio,‚Äù May said Tuesday. ‚ÄúAnd then I still have some PTSD with our shooting woes in February. And so I look [‚Ä¶]
articles.content:
Ten minutes after each practice, Dusty May is handed a stat sheet. Given last year, there are two stats that his eyes are immediately drawn to.

‚ÄúThe first thing I look at is assist-to-turnover ratio,‚Äù May said Tuesday. ‚ÄúAnd then I still have some PTSD with our shooting woes in February. And so I look at three-point percentage every single day. ‚Ä¶ We‚Äôve managed the turnover battle really, really well this year. ‚Ä¶ We‚Äôve just done a much better job of making better decisions, of simplifying our approach. And so up to this point, that‚Äôs been a real pleasant surprise.‚Äù

Those two stats ‚Äî assist-to-turnover ratio and three-point shooting ‚Äî were awfully relevant last season.

Michigan was consistently plagued by turnovers last season, with a whopping 19.6% of the Wolverines‚Äô possessions ending in a turnover. Few power-conference teams had a higher rate. Michigan‚Äôs misplays weren‚Äôt without range, from consecutive travel violations to slips and drops to flat-out bad passes. It wasn‚Äôt something that May shied away from, either, citing it in press conferences as a point of improvement throughout the season.

And yet, the Wolverines‚Äô offense chugged along, surviving partially on the fact that a good portion of their turnovers were on passes for dunks or layups, otherwise high-percentage shots that ‚Äî when the pass was made ‚Äî Michigan converted.

Just because the Wolverines progressed to the Sweet Sixteen in May‚Äôs debut year doesn‚Äôt mean Michigan quit analyzing the team‚Äôs turnovers troubles. Rather, with UNC transfer Elliot Cadeau as the new starting point guard, the Wolverines are taking a new approach.

‚ÄúWe give him reads,‚Äù assistant coach Akeem Miskdeen said. ‚ÄúSo when he‚Äôs going to the lane, he knows exactly where everybody should be. So he, honestly, could close his eyes and know, ‚ÄòI have a left guy, I have a guy that‚Äôs facing away.‚Äô So we give him reads when he goes in the lane, if he gets stuck, we have a big guy, what we call ‚Äòpivot duck‚Äô. He‚Äôs pivoting and ducking in, and you can throw it to him, so those reads probably make the game simpler for him.‚Äù

articles.title: Utiliza Word y Excel como un experto con la IA de Microsoft
articles.description: Ahora puedes usar la IA como asistente en la creaci√≥n y perfeccionamiento de archivos sin necesidad de experiencia previa
articles.content:
Crear documentos de Word y hojas de c√°lculo de Excel de nivel profesional ya no es una tarea exclusiva para expertos. Microsoft ha incorporado inteligencia artificial en sus aplicaciones cl√°sicas mediante el nuevo Modo Agente, una funci√≥n que permite a cualquier usuario, sin experiencia previa, generar y perfeccionar archivos de alta calidad con simples indicaciones en lenguaje natural.

Esta innovaci√≥n, impulsada por Microsoft 365 Copilot, marca un cambio en la forma en que las personas interact√∫an con las herramientas de productividad m√°s utilizadas en el mundo.

El Modo Agente representa una evoluci√≥n en la integraci√≥n de inteligencia artificial dentro de Word y Excel. Su prop√≥sito es democratizar el acceso a funciones avanzadas, eliminando la necesidad de dominar men√∫s complejos o f√≥rmulas t√©cnicas.

Al recibir instrucciones escritas en lenguaje cotidiano, la IA interpreta las necesidades del usuario y ejecuta tareas que antes requer√≠an conocimientos especializados. Esta funci√≥n se encarga de las labores m√°s complejas: redacta contenido, sugiere mejoras y plantea preguntas aclaratorias para afinar el resultado final.

Ejemplos pr√°cticos de uso en Word y Excel

En la pr√°ctica, el Modo Agente ofrece ejemplos concretos de c√≥mo la inteligencia artificial puede facilitar el trabajo diario. En Excel, basta con solicitar la creaci√≥n de un presupuesto familiar para que la herramienta genere categor√≠as como alquiler, alimentos, servicios p√∫blicos, combustible y entretenimiento. Adem√°s, puede establecer f√≥rmulas que alertan si se supera o no el presupuesto, o incluso elaborar an√°lisis financieros para peque√±as empresas.

En Word, la IA asiste en la redacci√≥n y revisi√≥n de documentos tan variados como curr√≠culos, cartas personales, informes de progreso o res√∫menes ejecutivos, lo que permite que el usuario enfoque su atenci√≥n en el contenido y no en la estructura t√©cnica.

Proceso de interacci√≥n entre usuario e inteligencia artificial

El proceso de colaboraci√≥n entre el usuario y la inteligencia artificial es iterativo. Se inicia con una indicaci√≥n sencilla y, a partir de ah√≠, el usuario puede guiar a Copilot para que realice ajustes, refine el texto o a√±ada detalles espec√≠ficos. Sumit Chauhan, vicepresidente corporativo del grupo de productos Office de Microsoft, explic√≥ que el usuario comienza con una simple indicaci√≥n y luego trabaja de forma iterativa con Copilot, gui√°ndolo mientras orquesta tareas de varios pasos para entregar documentos, hojas de c√°lculo y presentaciones de alta calidad.

Esta din√°mica convierte a la IA en un asistente que acompa√±a y potencia la creatividad y productividad de cualquier persona.

En cuanto a la disponibilidad, el Modo Agente ya se encuentra activo en el programa Frontier para usuarios con licencia de Microsoft 365 Copilot y para suscriptores de Microsoft 365 Personal o Familiar. Actualmente, la funci√≥n est√° habilitada en la web y en ingl√©s, con planes de expansi√≥n a las versiones de escritorio en el corto plazo. Para utilizar el Modo Agente en Excel, es necesario instalar el complemento Excel Labs y seleccionar la opci√≥n correspondiente.

En Word, la funci√≥n tambi√©n est√° disponible en la versi√≥n web, y se prev√© su llegada a la aplicaci√≥n de escritorio pr√≥ximamente. Por su parte, Office Agent en Copilot chat permite crear presentaciones en PowerPoint y documentos en Word, aunque la integraci√≥n total con Excel y PowerPoint se ir√° ampliando de manera progresiva.

Desde la perspectiva de Microsoft, la colaboraci√≥n entre humanos y agentes de inteligencia artificial redefine el patr√≥n de trabajo en el entorno digital. La compa√±√≠a visualiza un futuro en el que la interacci√≥n fluida con la IA no solo simplifica tareas complejas, sino que tambi√©n transforma la manera en que las personas producen y perfeccionan informaci√≥n en su vida cotidiana y profesional.

As√≠, la llegada del Modo Agente inaugura una nueva etapa en la relaci√≥n entre usuarios y tecnolog√≠a, donde la inteligencia artificial se convierte en un socio activo en la creaci√≥n y gesti√≥n de documentos y datos.

articles.title: Mark Wahlberg Names One Of The 'Bullets' He's Dodged In His Career
articles.description: The actor was asked if there were any roles he regretted missing out on.
articles.content:
Mark Wahlberg dropped the name of a popular late ‚Äô90s action movie when he was asked last week about roles he could have had, but ultimately didn‚Äôt get.

But instead of regret, the actor sounded relieved.

‚ÄúYou know I dodged a couple of bullets,‚Äù Wahlberg revealed while speaking with Entertainment Weekly on Thursday. ‚ÄúI did a couple ones that weren‚Äôt so good. We don‚Äôt need to mention those.‚Äù

When pressed to name something, the star of ‚ÄúBoogie Nights‚Äù and ‚ÄúTed‚Äù responded, ‚ÄúThat wouldn‚Äôt be nice.‚Äù

And while Wahlberg didn‚Äôt cite any films he regretted doing, he did say that he was ‚Äúin talks‚Äù to play the superhero Robin in the 1997 film ‚ÄúBatman & Robin.‚Äù

‚ÄúI did not get an official offer, but I was meeting with Joel Schumacher about ‚ÄòBatman & Robin,‚Äô he said.

The role eventually went to Chris O‚ÄôDonnell, which was perfectly fine with Wahlberg because he ‚Äúwasn‚Äôt interested in that type of project.‚Äù

Buzz: Kristen Bell Reveals Minor Regret About Her Sex Life Before Marrying Dax Shepard

The topic was sparked after Leonardo DiCaprio shared that he‚Äôs still kicking himself for turning down the lead role in the 1997 film ‚ÄúBoogie Nights,‚Äù a role that ultimately went to Wahlberg.

‚ÄúMy biggest regret is not doing ‚ÄòBoogie Nights‚Äô,‚Äù DiCaprio said. ‚ÄúIt was a profound movie of my generation. I can‚Äôt imagine anyone but Mark [Wahlberg] in it. When I finally got to see that movie, I just thought it was a masterpiece.‚Äù

articles.title: Trump considering Chicago for military training draws ire of Pritzker, Johnson
articles.description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson also addressed Trump's comments.
articles.content:
CHICAGO (WGN) ‚Äî President Donald Trump and Illinois Governor JB Pritzker continued their long-running war of words on Tuesday, as the president spoke about using the city of Chicago as a training ground for military troops.

Arguing the US is fighting a war from within, Trump floated a new way on how he might like to use the military in the Windy City. During a rare gathering of America‚Äôs top military commanders, Trump defended using troops to help police cities and took aim at Chicago.

‚ÄúI told Pete (Hegseth), we should use some of these dangerous cities as training grounds for our military, National Guard, but military, because we‚Äôre going into Chicago very soon,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a big city with an incompetent governor, stupid governor. Stupid.‚Äù

Pritzker says 100 National Guard troops could be deployed to Chicago amid ongoing ‚ÄòOperation Midway Blitz‚Äô

President Trump‚Äôs threat to send troops to Chicago seems closer to becoming reality after the Department of Homeland Security sent a memo to the Defense Department seeking help protecting immigration enforcement agents and facilities.

‚ÄúIt appears that Donald Trump ‚Äì not only has dementia set in, but he‚Äôs copying the tactics of Vladimir Putin,‚Äù Pritzker said.

Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson also addressed Trump‚Äôs comments, saying, ‚ÄúAmerican cities are not a training ground for the military. Quite frankly, it‚Äôs appalling that he would even suggest such a thing. This is further evidence and proof that he‚Äôs an unstable, unhinged individual.‚Äù

Pritzker says the Trump administration is using the need to protect the United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) as a way to normalize the use of the military in American cities. The governor says that‚Äôs why he won‚Äôt call the president.

‚ÄúEvery weekend they lose five, six ‚Äì if they lose five, they‚Äôre considering it a great week, they shouldn‚Äôt lose any,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs always up there saying, ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre in good shape, we don‚Äôt need the military.‚Äô No, they need the military desperately.‚Äù

Johnson, who touts Chicago‚Äôs gains in reducing crime, blasted the president‚Äôs interest in cities with diverse communities.

‚ÄúWhere the population is most pronounced, which is our cities where working-class people live, Black, brown, white, Asian families live, that this is somehow a playground for his militarized obsession,‚Äù Johnson said.

As the mayor and governor work to keep residents informed, they acknowledge that there‚Äôs only so much they can do to counter the federal government.

‚ÄúThere is nothing we can do in terms of putting our law enforcement in the way of federal law enforcement when they are carrying out ‚Äì wrong but accurate ‚Äì federal laws,‚Äù Pritzker said. ‚ÄúWe need comprehensive immigration reform, that is what will matter. And what we can do when it comes to troops being sent into Chicago and the state of Illinois is immediately go to court. We‚Äôre prepared to do that.‚Äù

Some elected officials in Illinois say they do want the Trump administration‚Äôs help. Cook County commissioner Sean Morris, a Republican, called the mayor and governor‚Äôs statements about federal law enforcement activity ‚Äúreckless.‚Äù
