articles.title: 2027: Athena Centre To Launch Electoral Observatory, Sets Agenda For Next INEC Chair
articles.description: The Athena Centre for Policy and Leadership has announced a major initiative aimed at bolstering the credibility of Nigeria's elections, starting with the
articles.content:
The Athena Centre for Policy and Leadership has announced a major initiative aimed at bolstering the credibility of Nigeria‚Äôs elections, starting with the upcoming off-cycle polls in November and extending to the crucial 2027 general election.

The Centre‚Äôs Chancellor and former minister of Aviation, Chief Osita Chidoka, disclosed this in Abuja on Tuesday during a press briefing to unveil a landmark report on electoral technology and a new monitoring platform, the Athena Electoral Observatory, scheduled for launch on October 6, 2025.

Chidoka stated that the report, titled ‚ÄòInnovations in Electoral Technology, 2015 to 2025: Gains, Gaps and the Road Ahead,‚Äô was designed to be a national conversation on the future of Nigeria‚Äôs democracy, bringing together politicians, INEC officials, civil society, development partners, and security agencies.

‚ÄúOur mission is to ensure that every innovation strengthens, not undermines, the legitimacy of Nigeria‚Äôs elections,‚Äù Chidoka said.

He said that the report was the culmination of three pre-event workshops held in September with key stakeholders and integrated findings from a nationwide opinion poll conducted by NOI Polls, offering fresh citizen perspectives on electoral technology and trust ahead of the 2027 elections.

The former minister of Aviation said that a key highlight of the October event will be the formal launch of the Athena Electoral Observatory, which he described as a permanent platform for electoral accountability.

‚ÄúThe Athena Electoral Observatory will serve as Nigeria‚Äôs independent lens on elections, objective, evidence-based, and citizen-focused.

‚ÄúThe platform will monitor Nigeria‚Äôs elections and election technology, track global innovations, provide evidence-based assessment of reforms, and deliver independent insights,‚Äù he said.

Responding to questions from journalists thereafter, Chidoka clarified that the Centre‚Äôs review was strategically timed to set a clear, evidence-based agenda for the next chairman of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC).

‚ÄúThis is a review of INEC‚Äôs technological innovations over the past 10 years. We are going to be looking at all the technology INEC has introduced and how it has functioned in our electoral journey.

‚ÄúAre there gains? Are there gaps? And how do we take it forward? We have been conducting post-election audits. We‚Äôve done them in four states now and also in some by-elections. We‚Äôre going to use those post-election audits as a benchmark to see how INEC‚Äôs technology has helped us.

‚ÄúOur expectation is that this review will help us know whether these INEC technologies are relevant to the electoral process. What about them should we sustain and what gaps should we close? Inevitably, this is now setting an agenda for the new chairman. We don‚Äôt want to wait for the new chairman to come.

‚ÄúWe want to review what has happened and we want to hear from INEC what the challenges are and why some of these gaps exist, so that the new INEC chairman comes on board with clear clarity about what is working and what needs to be improved,‚Äù he explained.

The Chancellor emphasised that the Centre‚Äôs work was driven by data, not speculation, saying, ‚ÄúAt the Athena Centre, we are driven by data. We are driven by evidence. We are driven by objective, verifiable information.‚Äù

He further stated that their past post-election audits have even led to the naming of specific polling officials who tampered with results, and that the findings would provide a practical template for immediate and long-term reform.

‚ÄúThis offers us an opportunity to ensure that what is good with the INEC technology is sustained. The gaps that are identified are put forward to be fixed before we get to 2027,‚Äù he stated.

articles.title: Italy‚Äôs Meloni says Gaza flotilla risks escalation, could ‚Äòblow up' potential ceasefire deal
articles.description: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni blasted the Gaza flotilla for exploiting civilians as Israel braces for escalation, raising fears it could derail Donald Trump‚Äôs peace push.
articles.content:
The Gaza-bound flotilla involving anti-Israel activists and celebrities, including Greta Thunberg, has drawn sharp criticism from Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, as Israel watches closely amid fears it could derail Donald Trump‚Äôs push for a peace deal.

Meloni warned the flotilla is intended to destabilize Trump‚Äôs peace plan, stating on X, "The truth is simple: those aids can be delivered without risks ‚Ä¶ Insisting on wanting to force a naval blockade means making oneself- Knowingly or not- instruments of those who want to blow up every possibility of [a] ceasefire. Spare us the lesson in morality on peace if your goal is escalation. And do not exploit the civilian population of Gaza if you are not truly interested in their fate."

The Trump administration has framed its 20-point plan as the path to both ending the war in Gaza and securing the release of Israeli hostages, but the flotilla could shift the narrative back toward confrontation.

TRUMP UNVEILS 20-POINT PLAN TO SECURE PEACE IN GAZA, INCLUDING GRANTING SOME HAMAS MEMBERS ‚ÄòAMNESTY'

On X, Israeli Foreign Minister Gideon Saar stated, "The flotilla to Gaza is not a humanitarian act, but a dangerous provocation intended to inflame tensions and undermine ongoing diplomatic efforts."

The Global Sumud Flotilla describes itself as a "multinational civilian effort to break Israel‚Äôs illegal siege of Gaza," saying the flotilla is the largest attempt to date to break Israel‚Äôs maritime blockade of the Gaza Strip, which has now lasted 18 years. Israel says the blockade is needed to prevent Hamas from importing arms.

The Sumud flotilla is now moving into waters that fall within Israel‚Äôs exclusive economic zone and is expected to reach Israeli waters around Yom Kippur with nearly 50 vessels and hundreds of anti-Israel activists on board. According to Israel‚Äôs Channel 12 News, Jerusalem has deployed 600 police officers and naval units, and even set up a special court at Ktzi‚Äôot Prison to process detainees, with security officials warning of possible provocations at sea. "This is a sensitive and complex operation, and we are preparing for provocations," a senior Israeli police officer said.



 TRUMP SAYS ‚ÄòREAL CHANCE FOR GREATNESS‚Äô AS NETANYAHU WHITE HOUSE MEETING LOOMS FOR GAZA TALKS

The flotilla has drawn international attention not only because of Thunberg‚Äôs participation but also because of its European and regional connections. The fleet departed from Barcelona, with activists supported by groups in Spain, which Jerusalem claims is tied to Hamas operative Saif Abu Kashk, who allegedly runs a front company that Israeli intelligence claims controls many of the ships.

At the same time, Turkey says it has been monitoring the flotilla with drones, with Ankara saying it may assist further "on humanitarian grounds." Turkey has been accused of sheltering Hamas members in the country.

For Israel, observers say the challenge is to prevent activists from reaching Gaza while avoiding an international incident that could play into Hamas‚Äôs hands. As Trump works to lock in a deal, the looming confrontation at sea risks shifting headlines away from diplomacy and back toward conflict.

CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP

On Tuesday, Israel released documents tying the flotilla‚Äôs organizers to Hamas through the Palestinian Conference for Palestinians Abroad (PCPA). The group, established in Turkey in 2017, has been designated a terrorist organization by Israel and accused of serving as Hamas‚Äôs overseas arm.

articles.title: Yankees have no one but themselves to blame for empty seats in AL Wild Card series
articles.description: The New York Yankees are set to play what's easily the highest anticipated Wild Card Series against their arch-rivals, the Boston Red Sox, with all three games
articles.content:
The New York Yankees are set to play what's easily the highest anticipated Wild Card Series against their arch-rivals, the Boston Red Sox, with all three games set to be played at Yankee Stadium. The Yankees-Red Sox rivalry is known to be one of the best in all of sports, and it only kicks up a notch when they meet in October.

Given that, it'd be fair to expect Yankee Stadium to be packed well before first pitch and for ticket prices to be astronomical. Well, that isn't exactly the case on either front, and the Yankees are entirely to blame for that.

For more news and rumors, check out MLB Insider Robert Murray‚Äôs work on The Baseball Insiders podcast, subscribe to The Moonshot, our weekly MLB newsletter, and join the discord to get the inside scoop during the MLB season.

Yankees are to blame for empty seats in Wild Card Series opener

You read that right. The Yankees limited ticket sales to residents of New York, New Jersey, Connecticut or Pennsylvania for Game 1 of this series. The intention behind this is quite clear - they'd like for the crowd to consist of only Yankees fans.

We've seen teams in several sports do this, but never have we seen the Yankees, arguably the most popular sports team on the planet, restrict ticket sales. The Yankees should enjoy every bit of their home-field advantage, but is it not incredibly lame to restrict ticket buyers to individuals who don't live in Massachusetts?

I'm not going to say all of those empty seats would've been filled by Red Sox fans, and I'm not saying Yankees fans should want Red Sox fans to fill those seats, but again, empty seats? In this game? That's a bad look, no matter how you slice it.

I'm not going to act like a get-in price of $92 is dirt cheap, but for the first postseason game at Yankee Stadium against the Red Sox with Max Fried and Garrett Crochet on the mound, $92 to get in doesn't feel that crazy, especially when the get-in price for the Chicago Cubs game, which took place in the early afternoon at Wrigley Field, was even more expensive for a seat.

This, probably, has a lot to do with the Yankees limiting who can buy tickets to this game. Having prices be that low and still not being able to even come close to filling the place up before introductions is not ideal. The seats will almost certainly fill most of the way up as the game progresses, but a game of this magnitude not being sold out from the jump is just shocking.

articles.title: Gunshots, robbery victims, should be treated while awaiting police report ‚Äî Expert
articles.description:
Gunshots, robbery victims, should be treated while awaiting police report ‚Äî Expert







A Medical Practitioner, Dr Abib Olamitoye, has urged operators of me
articles.content:
Gunshots, robbery victims, should be treated while awaiting police report ‚Äî Expert

A Medical Practitioner, Dr Abib Olamitoye, has urged operators of medical facilities in Nigeria to always attend to victims of gunshots and robbery first, while awaiting police report.

Speaking during an interview with newsmen Ibadan on Tuesday, Olamitoye noted that this would save a lot of victims from preventative deaths that usually occurred while waiting for treatment clearance from the police.

Olamitoye, Founder and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Ibadan Central Hospital, suggested the need for all medical facilities to have good working relationship and contact phone numbers of police divisions within their jurisdictions, for such emergencies.

‚ÄúWe need to start attending to the victims first, then demand for police report and if a victim or a relative cannot provide police report in the process of treatment, then hospitals can call the attention of the police, since the victim is under their care and cannot escape with such condition.

‚ÄúThe patient must be kept alive first, then we can now talk about police report, price, hospital card and other necessary things,‚Äù he said.

Speaking on medical tourism among the political class, he noted that majority of the locally trained medical practitioners, could do far better than their counterparts trained abroad, if provided with the right infrastructure and good working conditions.

He noted that some locally trained medical practitioners had resolved many complex medical issues excellently, even with improvised equipments and unfriendly working environment.

Olamitoye then urged government to urgently address welfare, infrastructure decay and other issues in the country‚Äôs medical sector, to prevent brain drain that had been ravaging the sector.

‚ÄúCosts and condition of training medical practitioners in Nigeria should be a great concern to government and the general public.

‚ÄúDuring our time as students at the University College Hospital (UCH) Ibadan, there was nothing like power failure or shortage of water.

‚ÄúThe medical tourism is not as a result of lack of competent hands, but due to decayed infrastructure and other issues.

‚ÄúWe need urgent attention to issues of doctors welfare packages, as they spend longer years to study. They need to feed their families and meet up with other responsibilities.

‚ÄúForeign countries put more value on Nigerian doctors and that is why they excel when they get the right equipments and good environment to work over there,‚Äù he said.

articles.title: Gobernador de C√≥rdoba recorri√≥ las obras de Monter√≠a para ver avance en Plan Masivo de Pavimentaci√≥n
articles.description: Este plan ya tiene un avance del 35% en todos los frentes de trabajo. Ac√° le contamos sobre este progreso y el impacto a la calidad de vida de los monterianos.
articles.content:
El gobernador de C√≥rdoba, Erasmo Zuleta Bechara, recorri√≥ el pasado 25 de septiembre los principales frentes de trabajo de la Revoluci√≥n de las Obras en Monter√≠a, que es uno de los ejes centrales de su plan de gobierno.

El principal objetivo de este recorrido era constatar los avances del Plan Masivo de Pavimentaci√≥n, que ya llega al 35% y que contempla la intervenci√≥n de 8.000 metros lineales de v√≠as en diferentes barrios de la capital cordobesa, acompa√±ados de parques, espacios recreativos y equipamientos que fomentan la cohesi√≥n social.

Adem√°s, durante su visita, el gobernador Zuleta destac√≥ que estos proyectos van m√°s all√° de un escenario deportivo o una calle pavimentada: ‚ÄúQueremos que estos lugares se conviertan en espacios familiares y motivos para reunirse en casa para mejorar sus condiciones‚Äù, como explic√≥.

Hay algunas obras que cuentan con unos avances destacados en su ejecuci√≥n. Al respecto, el mandatario cordob√©s asegur√≥: ‚ÄúEstas obras son m√°s que cemento y asfalto, significan bienestar, comercio, deporte y espacios de encuentro para las familias. Monter√≠a est√° viviendo una transformaci√≥n hist√≥rica y no vamos a detenernos‚Äù. Por ese motivo, ac√° le dejamos algunos de los avances que resaltan en este plan:
‚Ä¢ - Barrio 6 de Marzo: alcanz√≥ un 60% de pavimentaci√≥n, con 735 de los 1.300 metros proyectados listos para el tr√°nsito seguro de peatones y veh√≠culos, fortaleciendo el comercio y la movilidad del sector.
‚Ä¢ - Estadio de Pasatiempo: registra un 75 % de progreso, con obras en el encerramiento, el campo de juego, las grader√≠as y los ‚Äòdogouts‚Äô, convirti√©ndose en un nuevo epicentro para el b√©isbol y el softbol monteriano.
‚Ä¢ - Barrio La Pradera: presenta un 25 % de avance, con la construcci√≥n de senderos peatonales, zonas biosaludables, as√≠ como el muro posterior, garantizando un espacio integral para el deporte y la recreaci√≥n.
‚Ä¢ - Barrio Cantaclaro: la pavimentaci√≥n alcanza el 90 %, mientras se ejecutan trabajos en andenes y la limpieza de los canales de drenaje, mejorando la calidad ambiental y la seguridad vial.
‚Ä¢ - Parque Castilla la Nueva ‚Äì futuro Parque de La Paz: avanza en un 12 %, con proyecci√≥n de cancha de f√∫tbol, √°rea de bateo, pista de patinaje y zona biosaludable, pensado como un espacio de integraci√≥n y actividad f√≠sica.
‚Ä¢ - Barrio El Recreo: presenta un 35 % de pavimentaci√≥n, optimizando la movilidad y elevando la calidad de vida de los habitantes.

De esta manera, las obras del Plan Masivo de Pavimentaci√≥n est√°n transformando el urbanismo en la capital cordobesa, as√≠ como generando bienestar y calidad de vida entre los monterianos en una ciudad moderna y competitiva: ‚ÄúMonter√≠a est√° cambiando su rostro con infraestructura que genera oportunidades, dinamiza la econom√≠a y mejora la calidad de vida de todos. Esta es la verdadera revoluci√≥n de C√≥rdoba, y seguiremos trabajando barrio por barrio para que cada monteriano sienta el progreso en su puerta‚Äù, a√±adi√≥ el gobernador Zuleta.

articles.title: Inter Milan 3-0 Slavia Prague, UEFA Champions League: Martinez Bags Brace In Dominant Display
articles.description: Lautaro Martinez has now netted three braces for Inter Milan in the UEFA Champions League, the joint-most of any player in club history alongside both Adriano and Hernan Crespo
articles.content:
Captain Lautaro Martinez scored on either side of Denzel Dumfries' 34th-minute strike as Cristian Chivu's side start this season's competition with back-to-back clean sheets and six points from six.

The hosts took the lead at the San Siro on the half-hour mark as they pounced on an error from Praha goalkeeper Jindrich Stanek. The goalkeeper's pass inside his box was intercepted by Martinez, who found the net with a first-time finish.

And Inter doubled their lead just four minutes later when Marcus Thuram, who scored both goals in their 2-0 win over Ajax on MD1, assisted Dumfries as the Dutch defender turned the ball home at the near post.

Chivu's side should have made it 3-0 when Petar Sucic was played through by Martinez and rounded Stanek, but Stepan Chaloupek cleared the ball off the line with a last-ditch challenge.

However, Martinez secured the win in the 65th minute, finishing off a free-flowing move from Inter as he converted from Alessandro Bastoni's cross to complete a comfortable victory for the Nerazzurri.

7 - Lautaro Mart√≠nez is the first player to score for Inter in seven different seasons in the European Cup/UEFA Champions League. Footprint.#InterSlaviaPraha #UCL pic.twitter.com/GX1rLkN6Kh ‚Äî OptaPaolo (@OptaPaolo) September 30, 2025

Despite seeing his side net three times, Chivu may have expected more goals from the chances they created. Inter produced 3.67 expected goals (xG) from 21 attempts, while they restricted Praha to 0.12 from three shots.

Martinez has now netted three braces for Inter in the Champions League, the joint-most of any player in club history alongside both Adriano and Hernan Crespo, while only Alessandro Altobelli (36) has more goals for the Nerazzurri across major European competition than the Argentine forward (26).

Praha, meanwhile, have failed to win any of their nine away matches across major European competition against sides from Italy (D1 L8), conceding 2.2 goals on average per match during that time.

articles.title: Jose Siri: Enters free agency
articles.description: Jose Siri: Enters free agency
articles.content:
Siri elected free agency Tuesday, Anthony DiComo of MLB.com reports.

Siri passed through waivers unclaimed after being DFA'd by the Mets last Wednesday, and he'll now enter the open market to begin the offseason. The 30-year-old missed most of the 2025 season with a fractured left tibia and went just 2-for-32 (.063) in the big leagues while healthy.
